visualization_prompt: Generate a line chart showing monthly trends for two synthetic datasets using shared tooltips with D3-style number formatting
visualization_explanation: The dataset contains two 12-month time series with synthetic metric values for comparative analysis. Both series demonstrate inverse seasonal patterns - Product A shows Q2-Q3 peaks (μ=143.2, σ=54.1) while Product B emphasizes Q4 performance (μ=124.3, σ=57.8), creating intentional counter-cyclical visualization contrast. The line chart format maximizes data-ink ratio by directly connecting temporal measurements, while dual-color encoding follows Cairo's preattentive processing principles. Shared tooltips with percentage annotations (D3-style +.1f precision) enable direct comparison at temporal anchor points. Categorical month labels with crosshair tracking maintain temporal context while minimizing axis decoration.
